column4: I'm compiling for the first time. I am following the guide here, https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CompilingEasyHowTo, but I have a question. Once I finish compiling do I still need the folder I used to compile it in or can I delete it? (Here they use /usr/local/src)
If you have the binary files you don't need the actual source code any more.  Make sure you don't delete some files you didn't compile yet though!
I'm installing bitfighter and it said on the website that I have to compile it for Linux.
Once it's compile you don't need the source code any more.
By ending the command with a &  (i.e. firefox&)
when I close my terminal it closes my program as well
I did. It allows me to do other things with the terminal, but once I close the terminal, the program closes as well.
did you see my problem? (can't repost, on iPhone)
About the app closing when you close the panel?
yeah, I posted a rather long description about it.
That is exactly what you should do.
Thumbs up to you good sir!
I think it is easier to set up a repo :P Just add to /etc/apt/sources.list ^^
You can add PPA's to /etc/apt/sources.list no?
I always used apt-something...can't remember. Basically they're the same thing though.
